intro: Echinopogon nutans, commonly known as the nodding hairgrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Poaceae family. It is a small, perennial grass that typically grows in open, sandy or gravelly soils. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and dense clusters of tiny, spike-like flowers that droop downward. Its inflorescence consists of several spikelets that are often adorned with short, bristly hairs. Echinopogon nutans is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand salty and windy conditions.
